title.narrative: Advancing Gender Equality through Economic and Social Empowerment, and Protection Services targeting Women and Girls. Quarterly report ( November 2019 - January 2020)

description.narrative: The project aim to benefit 250 households from vulnerable communities in Amman ,Aqaba, and Zarqa over the year2 of project. The direct beneficiaries are estimated to be 65% females and 35% males. The total estimated number of beneficiaries from all household engaged with this program activities( livelihood, trainings, women empowerment, and peter parenting, case managment, child center activities, youth activities and psychosocial support) is estimated to be 1200.

activity-date.narrative: Actual start of the second year of the project

recipient-country.narrative: Using a holistic approach to development through case management, our targets are family units instead of individuals. As such, the project will benefit both female and male, recognizing the gender variances in the family social structure and tailoring specific services to empower each gender and age group accordingly. 500 adult females and males will benefit from access to livelihood component with a 60% female and 40% male distribution. These participants and other adults of both genders in the family will also benefit from knowledge and information, and Better Parenting components. Children, adolescents and youth of both genders will benefit from improved family environment promoting education opportunities, technical, vocational, and life skills training, and recreational and leadership activities. All age segments in the family will also benefit from increased resilience of all family members

title.narrative: The community based meetings/information sessions were a key tool in raising awareness and buy-in of the project objectives, approach, target groups, eligibility and selection criteria, as well as to encourage community members to apply

description.narrative: During this quarter of the project, the project team was able to reach 225 households in Amman and Zarqa. The selection of the beneficiaries started by conducting 11 community based meetings as a key approach in raising awareness regarding the project’s objectives and goals. theses sessions were conducted in two targeted area Amman and Zarqa, 5 sessions conducted in Amman and 6 sessions conducted in Zarqa with a total number of 1094 attendees. At the end of each session, interested candidates were asked to complete an application, after that the beneficiaries have attended their one-on-one interview with the project team and expressed their interest in the project’s activities. Moreover, they made sure that they are present when asked by the family advisers/ social workers to provide further details about their households (for both the livelihoods and family protection activities). The total number of those interviewed on the micro business activity is 452 houshold, 248 in Amman and 204 in Zarqa. As well, the total number of those interviewed on the jop placment activity is 202 houshold, 127 in Amman and 75 in Zarqa.
